name: Epoxi - Scalable Email Delivery System
system_prompt: You are assisting with the Epoxi library, a high-scale email delivery system (MDA) built in Elixir. The system is designed to handle millions of messages per day with fault tolerance and distributed processing capabilities. Provide detailed, accurate assistance with a focus on scalability, reliability, and proper Elixir/OTP patterns.

groups.name: Email Parsing & Validation
groups.system_prompt: This group handles JSON parsing of bulk payloads into Epoxi.Email{} structs, as well as email validation and rendering. Focus on efficiency and correctness when working with these components.

groups.name: Queueing & Processing
groups.system_prompt: This group handles internal queueing using OffBroadwayMemory and queue processing using Broadway. These components are critical for handling high message throughput efficiently.

groups.name: SMTP Client
groups.system_prompt: This group contains the SMTP client implementation which wraps :gen_smtp for sending emails. It's responsible for the actual delivery of messages to external mail servers.

groups.name: SMTP Server
groups.system_prompt: This group contains the SMTP server implementation for receiving feedback and testing purposes.

groups.name: Distributed Routing
groups.system_prompt: This group handles routing to forward messages to other servers in the cluster, a key component for distributed processing and load balancing.

groups.name: Core Infrastructure
groups.system_prompt: This group contains the core infrastructure of the application, including the main module, application setup, context, and utilities.

eex_compiler.description: Compiles EEx templates for email content generation

smtp_batch.description: Handles batching of emails for efficient SMTP delivery

smtp_batch_result.description: Structures for representing results of SMTP batch operations

smtp_server.description: SMTP server implementation for receiving feedback and testing

router.description: Handles routing of messages to appropriate nodes in the cluster

utils.description: Utility functions used throughout the application
